question: How do I add a kernel parameter permanently?

golden_answer.summary: Edit /etc/default/grub, add parameter to GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT, then regenerate GRUB config with grub-mkconfig.
steps: Add your parameter inside quotes: GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash nomodeset"
validation: System boots correctly with new parameter
warnings: Wrong kernel parameters can make system unbootable
Have live USB ready for recovery
Common parameters: quiet, splash, nomodeset, acpi=off, intel_iommu=on
Test parameter temporarily first by editing GRUB menu at boot (press 'e')
Changes don't take effect until reboot
